title.narrative: 1.2 MATERNAL AND NEONATAL HEALTH SUPPORT

description.narrative: A package of knowledge products, skills and tools is available to ensure equitable access to quality maternal, neonatal and child health services, including emergency obstetric and newborn care (EmONC)., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health Systems Strengthening, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Maternal And Newborn Health, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programs

sector.narrative: Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: A package of knowledge products, skills and tools is available to ensure equitable access to quality maternal, neonatal and childhealth services, including emergency obstetric and newborn care (EmONC).

description.narrative: As of September 2021, the number of UNICEF-supported health facilities offering delivery services with functional new-born resuscitation and the number of convergence county hospitals equipped with the necessary equipment to provide comprehensive emergency obstetric care services remains unchanged from 2020 (nine;in total) due to a reprioritization of Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care;in the 2021 Work Plan due to the impact of;COVID-19 prevention measures. | Status:No progress | As-of Date:12/01/2022
